basics.name: Ayush Jain
basics.label: Final-year CSE undergrad @ MUJ
basics.summary: Final-year computer science undergrad based in India, interested in building practical NLP systems and machine learning models that hold up outside notebooks.

work.name: IndianOil Corporation Ltd.
work.summary: Worked on an NLP project focused on extracting actionable insights from large volumes of Google Reviews for IndianOil retail outlets using aspect-based sentiment analysis.
highlights: Fine-tuned BERT-based models for aspect-based sentiment analysis, improving classification accuracy from 60% to 78% through custom loss weighting.
Optimized preprocessing and feature extraction pipelines, reducing latency by around 60% using vectorized operations.
Deployed the inference pipeline into a production Python environment to support real-time requests from internal systems.

awards.title: Dean’s List – Excellence in Academics
awards.summary: Awarded for maintaining a GPA above 9 across multiple semesters.

projects.name: IRIS – Intelligent Retinal Imaging System
projects.summary: A backend system for retinal image classification, designed to provide fast and reliable inference through a deployed API.
highlights: Designed and deployed an inference API using FastAPI and Docker on AWS EC2.
Maintained low-latency responses in the 2–3 second range under real-world conditions.
